data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you always face forward, then you always go forward. Take 9 steps right. If you always face right, then you always go right. So, the answer is no.

Take 4 steps to turn around then turn around once again. The starting point is at the end of the circle. So, the answer is yes.

Forward facing means facing the forward direction. To return to the starting point, a person would always face forward and take the correct amount of steps. To always take the correct amount of steps, you would take the first right after starting. Again, to always take the correct amount of steps, you should take the first right after taking the first left. So, the answer is Yes.

Just because you always face forward does not mean that all steps lead back to you. If you take 4 steps left you are taking 4 steps back and 3 steps forward are the same thing except that you took 3 steps forward so you are taken 3 back and 3 steps forward. As long as you always face forward the steps you take does not mean that you always return to the starting point. So, the answer is yes.
